body_content.explanation: to cut something with a knife or other sharp object again:
examples: The water in the vase should be changed regularly, and the flower stems recut each time.
After a disastrous trip to the hairdresser, I got my hair recut, and now I love it!

body_content.explanation: to cut a film (= remove unwanted parts or arrange the parts in a different way) again:
examples: There were rumours that the film was recut against the director's wishes.
The movie - filmed in early 2001 - had to be recut in the wake of 9/11.

body_content.explanation: to divide a pile of playing cards into two parts again:
examples: The dealer will retrieve the card, reshuffle, and recut the cards.

body_content.explanation: to make a new deal with someone:
examples: There is growing speculation that the deal will be recut to give the Japanese group a bigger stake in the company.
